p: (1R,2S)-5-(1-benzyl-2-phenylcyclopropyl)-1H-tetrazole (29). Sodium azide (78 mg, 1.56 mmol) and triethylamine (167 µL, 1.2 mmol) were added to a solution of 1-benzyl-2-phenylcyclopropanecarbonitrile 28 (90 mg, 0.39 mmol) in DMF (3 ml) at room temperature. The reaction mixture was stirred under nitrogen atmosphere at 130 °C for 16 h until TLC monitoring revealed complete consumption of the starting material. 1 N HCl aq. solution (10 ml) was added and the resulting solution was extracted with ethyl acetate (3 × 10 ml). The organic phases were washed with brine, dried over anhydrous Na 2SO 4, filtered and concentrated under reduced pressure to give a crude material that is purified by flash column chromatography using 33% ethyl acetate in petroleum ether. The product was obtained as an oil in 46% yield. 1H NMR (300 MHz, CDCl 3) δ 7.92 (s, 1H), 7.46 − 7.09 (m, 10H), 3.19 (d, J = 16.3 Hz, 1H), 2.95 (dt, J = 22.9, 11.4 Hz, 1H), 2.49 (d, J = 16.3 Hz, 1H), 2.01 (ddd, J = 9.1, 5.3, 1.2 Hz, 1H), 1.72 (dd, J = 7.0, 5.3 Hz, 1H). 13 C NMR (101 MHz, CDCl 3) δ 162.7, 139.1, 136.9, 129.3, 128.8, 128.5, 127.0, 126.7, 35.7, 32.4, 25.0, 19.1. MS (ESI): m/z: 275 [M-H].
